DataElement.preferredName: Heart LVEF Test Percentage Upper Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The value in percentage for the ejection fraction of the left ventricle of the heart which is measured as an institutional standard for the highest value considered as a normal test result.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the left ventricle ejection fraction heart test.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A hollow muscular organ which receives the blood from the veins and propels it into the arteries. It is divided by a musculomembranous septum into two halves -- right or venous and left or arterial -- each of which consists of a receiving chamber (atrium) and an ejecting chamber (ventricle). SYN cor, coeur.

Concepts.definition: A hollow organ located slightly to the left of the middle portion of the chest. It is composed of muscle and it is divided by a septum into two sides: the right side which receives de-oxygenated blood from the body and the left side which sends newly oxygenated blood to the body. Each side is composed of two chambers: the atrium (receiving blood) and ventricle (ejecting blood).

Property.preferredDefinition: The ejection fraction (or, more correctly, left-ventricular ejection fraction, often abbreviated LVEF) is a measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber. (Wikipedia):A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.longName: Measurement of Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction
Concepts.definition: A measure of how much blood the left ventricle of the heart pumps out with each contraction. With each beat, a normal heart ejects about one-half to two-thirds of the blood in its left chamber.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lab Percentage Upper Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The information contained in a data field of a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator fo the top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Percentage Upper Limit of Normal Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:The information contained in a data field.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
The information contained in a data field. It may represent a numeric quantity, a textual characterization, a date or time measurement, or some other state, depending on the nature of the attribute.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Versioned to changed the data type from character to number. AK 12/14/17
